Wisp03.speaker: 30ff3b73-fd30-4f26-bb8f-1256320add33
Wisp03.text: |Our commander will talk to your leader.|

DaisyAD_WispDead.text: You prove yourself an unworthy ally.

PAD_ComingOutOfCave.speaker: Player
PAD_ComingOutOfCave.text: Hells. You look like you've seen a ghost.

session_synopses.Wisp04: One liner for Wisp04 in Astral Prison.
session_synopses.Wisp03: One liner for Wisp03 in Astral Prison.
session_synopses.AD_ReadyCheckFailed: Daisy tells you to come back when ready.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_WispDead: Daisy reacts to you killing them in wisp form.
session_synopses.PAD_ComingOutOfCave: Companions react to the avatar coming back out of the cave.

AD_PartySuppressionAstralPrismBeforeDais.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_PartySuppressionAstralPrismBeforeDais.text: By Vlkaakith's will, end the Prism-dweller. Violently.

session_synopses.AD_PartySuppressionAstralPrismBeforeDais: AD playing on Laezel while in the Creche Astral plane before speaking to Daisy

AD_TeletrapTriggered.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
AD_TeletrapTriggered.text: To arms! The traps have snagged a rat.
AD_TeletrapTriggered.context: InternalNodeContext: The Player has activated a trap

AD_TeletrapTriggered.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
AD_TeletrapTriggered.text: Defend the hatchery - kill the intruders!

NearEggWarning.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
NearEggWarning.text: Do not think you can take liberties because you are kin - stay away from the egg.
NearEggWarning.context: NodeContext: Getting annoyed now, a little aggressive; protective of the egg

Guard.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard.text: The hatchery is a dangerous place to linger, kin.

Guard.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard.text: Step carefully, kin. Our hatchery is protected by lethal safeguards - I would hate to see you fall foul of them.

Guard.speaker: Player
Guard.text: Hatchery? Where are all the eggs?

Guard.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard.text: Hatched, mostly. Only one remains unbroken, watched over by Varsh Ko'kuu, caretaker of our young.

Guard.speaker: Warrior Vu'un
Guard.text: You may speak to him if you wish, but do not approach the egg. Lest you fall foul of me.

PAD_EnteredGas.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredGas.text: What is that stink? It's making my head spin.

TouchWarning.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
TouchWarning.text: Do not touch the egg! This is your final warning, k'chakhi.

PAD_HatcheryComment.speaker: Player
PAD_HatcheryComment.text: Gods, it smells awful in here.

session_synopses.AD_TeletrapTriggered: The hatchery guard spots a player in the cage that the teleportation traps put people in.
session_synopses.NearEggWarning: The caretaker warns the player to not touch the egg.
session_synopses.Guard: A male gith guard, watching over the hatchery where gith eggs are hatched. He's a caustic personality, ready to kill anyone who touches the lone egg in the hatchery.
session_synopses.PAD_EnteredGas: The player is affected by the strange fumes in the hatchery surrounding the egg (actually gith pheromones). To non-gith, they stink and weaken you slightly (gain status to make you more vulnerable to physical damage). To gith characters, they're actually quite pleasant and make you feel tougher (status gives you resistence to physical damage boost).
session_synopses.TouchWarning: The caretaker warns the player to leave the egg. If it is repeated, he starts a fight.
session_synopses.PAD_HatcheryComment: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react toentering deeper into the hatchery. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.

AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile.text: Crche Y'llek - with me! To the death.

AD_TemplarGreeting.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarGreeting.text: You have something I want. I have the knowledge you need.

AD_LaezelTurnsHostile.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelTurnsHostile.text: I warned you, and you still turn away. This will not stand!

AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine.speaker: Ch'r'ai W'wargaz
AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine.text: Your life is over. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!

session_synopses.AD_TemplarTurnsCreacheHostile: This is an all-purpose combat-starting AD on the Inquisitor, if and when he turns the full crche hostile. It plays for a number of edge-cases that are the result of the player trespassing and if the player leaves the security office during the Vlaakith scene. It also plays at the start of the combat when he betrays the player on Vlaakith's command.
session_synopses.AD_TemplarCombatMindstealLine: He casts Projectile_CRE_GithyankiInquisitor_Mindsteal_Link for the first time
session_synopses.PAD_InactivePlanecasterComment: The player attempts to use an inactive planecaster in the security office of the Creche, and comments on it. The planecaster unlocks the Orpheus Box, but this PAD covers both knowing and not knowing that.
session_synopses.AD_TemplarGreeting: The Inquisitor greets the player and invites them to talk to him. He gets increasingly impatient if the player keeps ignoring him, ending with combat if the player doesn't go talk to him.Custom greeting node if he notices a player sneaking around.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelTurnsHostile: Lae'zel says this AD as she attacks the player for the following actions:- You walk out of the Creche Security office after Vlaakith orders you to enter the Astral Prism- You attack the Inquisitor
session_synopses.DaisyAD_UsePlanecaster: Daisy AD for when we click on the planecaster to start the process of entering the astral plane
session_synopses.AD_TemplarCombatFirstLine: First of three ADs that play at the start of a combat turn for the Inquisitor.
session_synopses.AD_TemplarCombatThirdLine: Last of three ADs that play at the start of a combat turn for the Inquisitor.

SWA.speaker: Ancient Giant Eagle
SWA.text: Please, get out of my nest. You'll give Xavier ideas.

SWA.speaker: Ancient Giant Eagle
SWA.text: INTRUDER! In MY NEST! This area was meant to be SAFE! Xavier, get behind mummy.
SWA.context: CinematicNodeContext: The giant eagle is chewing on the corpse of a Kobold. When the player approaches it looks up, and screeches out.NodeContext: all capitalised words are meant to be half sqwauked / Barclay line towards other eagle

SWA.speaker: Player
SWA.text: I'm just interested in the big device, I promise to not meddle with the nest.

SWA.speaker: Ancient Giant Eagle
SWA.text: Ugh, fine. Xavier! XAVIER! Don't talk to it. It might have germs.

session_synopses.SWA: SWA / Animal handling with the giant eagles on top of the monastery

PAD_GithSkeletonComment.speaker: Player
PAD_GithSkeletonComment.text: Only bones and armour left. Must've been part of the original raiding party.

PAD_FakeBloodSignReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_FakeBloodSignReaction.text: So they kept the 'Blood of Lathander' here? No wonder it was looted.

session_synopses.PAD_GithSkeletonComment: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to the Gith skeleton on the Monastery roof. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
session_synopses.PAD_FakeBloodSignReaction: The player characters react to finding an empty display altar for the Blood of Lathander.

AD_KoboldDrunkInBarrel.context: NodeContext: All of these are said inside of a barrel, semi-submerged in wine

AD_Combat_Kobold3FirstTurn.speaker: Kobold Inventor
AD_Combat_Kobold3FirstTurn.context: NodeContext: hiccup is a drunk being woken from a nap and pissed about it

session_synopses.AD_KoboldDrunkInBarrel: Drunken kobolds hiccuping in empty firewine barrels.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_Kobold3FirstTurn: Combat AD for the first turn of combat for S_CRE_Brewery_Kobold3 in the Monastery Brewery in CRE

AD_Roadsign01.speaker: Narrator
AD_Roadsign01.text: *North - Rosymorn Monastery. West - Moonrise Towers. South - Waukeen's Rest.*

AD_ArrivalStatuePlaque.speaker: Narrator
AD_ArrivalStatuePlaque.text: *Blessed be you, pilgrim. Take respite now in the Dawn's loving gaze.*

AD_GraveMarker03.speaker: Narrator
AD_GraveMarker03.text: *Do not walk in darkness. Turn to the light.*

PAD_MonasteryVista.speaker: Player
PAD_MonasteryVista.text: This view's almost worth the walk.

AD_FerrySign.speaker: Narrator
AD_FerrySign.text: *Approach the ferry in Lathander's grace. May his gaze shine upon you, pilgrim.*

AD_SCLSign.speaker: Narrator
AD_SCLSign.text: *Walk in the way of dawn, for Lathander cannot protect you where the light doth not reach.*

AD_FerryResult.speaker: Player
AD_FerryResult.text: That was tough, this can't have been used in a while.

session_synopses.AD_Roadsign: Roadsigns Pointing towards moonrise towers and the Lathander Monastery
session_synopses.AD_ArrivalStatuePlaque: A plaque at the base of a statue of Lathander.
session_synopses.PAD_MonasteryVista: The player characters take in the sight of the Monastery from the nearby cliff.
session_synopses.AD_FerrySign: A plaque guiding pilgrims to the ferry.
session_synopses.AD_SCLSign: An old plaque made by the Lathander monks, placed near the entrance of SCL
session_synopses.AD_FerryResult: This happens when the player attempts the athletics check to move the monastery ferry.

AD_Greeting.speaker: Lady Esther
AD_Greeting.text: A curse on every gith. Intransigent louts...

node_data.speaker: Lady Esther
node_data.text: What news of our little project? Have you found the egg?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Produce the owlbear egg.

node_data.speaker: Lady Esther
node_data.text: Oh you wonder- hold on.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Starts thrilled, saying "oh you wonderful person", but then realises she's not looking at the gith egg she thought she was. This is a different kind of egg.

node_data.speaker: Lady Esther
node_data.text: It looks different to what I expected. Are you sure that's a gith egg?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Unsure what she's looking at

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The curves, the colouration, the size - looks right to me.
False

node_data.speaker: Lady Esther
node_data.text: A rapscallion I can have grudging respect for. A bare-faced liar, on the other hand...
node_data.context: NodeContext: The player just lied to her, but she found them out

node_data.speaker: Lady Esther
node_data.text: Such conduct is distasteful. Don't come back without the right egg.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The player just lied to her, but she found them out

session_synopses.AD_Greeting: The expeditioner greets the player characters on sight.
session_synopses: An aging expeditioner gives the player the task of collecting a githyanki egg and debates nature vs. nurture.

PAD_HiddenNoteReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_HiddenNoteReaction.text: This 'blood' sounds important - could it still be here somewhere?

GlassWindow.speaker: Narrator
GlassWindow.text: *The monastery's notable keepers adorn these intricate panels.*
GlassWindow.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see a panning view of the stained glass, perhaps ending on a view from above. It is important that we get a relatively good view of each Dawnmaster before the question bank, as the puzzle components need to be clear to players who choose "leave."

PAD_RemovedWeaponReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_RemovedWeaponReaction.text: The weapon stopped glowing. How odd.

session_synopses.AD_Abbot2Plaque: Inscription on the second of the 4 altars for the weapons puzzle.
session_synopses.PAD_HiddenNoteReaction: The character comments on a note left by the last dawnmaster next to the hidden key in the weapons puzzle. The note cryptically refers to the Blood of Lathander, and catches the Player character's attention.
session_synopses.GlassWindow: The player inspects the glass window in the museum chamber of the Monastery.
session_synopses.AD_Abbot1Plaque: Inscription on the first of the 4 altars for the weapons puzzle.
session_synopses.AD_Abbot4Plaque: Inscription on fourth of the 4 altars for the weapons puzzle.
session_synopses.PAD_RemovedWeaponReaction: The player comments on the fact that the weapon removed from the altar no longer glows.

session_synopses.Cultist03_Dead: He reveals some info about the Absolute's activity at Moonrise.

PAD_LathanderStatue.speaker: Player
PAD_LathanderStatue.text: Undead crushed underfoot. The Dawnlord certainly knows how to make space for new life.

session_synopses.PAD_LathanderStatue: The player characters comment on an aspect of the Morninglord, Lathander.

AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter.text: The Blood of Lathander, as I barely live and hardly breathe. HahaHAhaha.

session_synopses.AD_BloodOfLathanderBanter: The spirit inside the Sentient Amulet, once a monk of Lathander, sees the true Blood of Lathander displayed before us. This was a holy relic for which many devout followers made their pilgrimage to the monastery that eventually became the Gith Creche.

AD_MagicMouthGauntlet03.speaker: Narrator
AD_MagicMouthGauntlet03.text: *The Morninglord's wrath awaits, heretic. Retreat whilst thou can.*
AD_MagicMouthGauntlet03.context: NodeContext: the message trails off as the spell runs out of words

AD_MagicMouthWarning.speaker: Bust
AD_MagicMouthWarning.text: Stand your ground! Keep them busy.

AD_MagicMouthWarning.speaker: Bust
AD_MagicMouthWarning.text: Lathander forgive me - we have to fire the Lance.

PAD_GithWeapon.speaker: Player
PAD_GithWeapon.text: That's a githyanki blade if ever I saw one.

AD_MagicMouthGauntlet02.speaker: Narrator
AD_MagicMouthGauntlet02.text: *Lathander's light may be infinite, but his mercy is not. Return. Now.*

PAD_MagicMouthKnowledgeCheck.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicMouthKnowledgeCheck.text: Talking statues are never a good sign.

Escape.text: CinematicNodeContext: A close-up of the chargning lance is shown, reaching its peak and firing.
Escape.context: CinematicNodeContext: A close-up of the chargning lance is shown, reaching its peak and firing.

PAD_Escaping_LeftRoof01.speaker: Player
PAD_Escaping_LeftRoof01.text: I need to get off this building before that thing explodes!

PAD_EnterGauntlet.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterGauntlet.text: Remarkable that this stayed hidden all this time.

PAD_FindOctogonal.speaker: Player
PAD_FindOctogonal.text: The shape is odd, feels strangely familiar...

AD_MagicMouthGauntlet01.speaker: Narrator
AD_MagicMouthGauntlet01.text: *If thou readst this, trespasser: turn back, lest your life be forfeit.*

PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance.speaker: Player
PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance.text: Quite a heavily guarded treasure, good job we got past those protections.

PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance.speaker: Player
PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance.text: This artefact must've been precious to the monks.

PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance.speaker: Player
PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance.text: That's no surprise. It looks powerful.

session_synopses.AD_MagicMouthGauntlet03: A plaque communicating the warning of the Abbess to intruders in the gauntlet. It warns the passerby to turn back and to not disturb the place.
session_synopses.AD_MagicMouthWarning: Magic mouth spell communicating the warning of the Abbess to the passing monks. Due to the limitations of the spell this AD can't be longer than 25 words! It warns the passerby of the invasion, and alludes to the plan to destroy it as a last ditch effort.
session_synopses.PAD_GithWeapon: AD spoken when approaching the body of a monk with a githyanki longsword through his chest.
session_synopses.AD_MagicMouthGauntlet02: A plaque communicating the warning of the Abbess to intruders in the gauntlet. It warns the passerby to turn back and to not disturb the place.
session_synopses.PAD_MagicMouthKnowledgeCheck: The player attempts to understand a magic mouth spell cast on a dagger warning the monks of the gith invasion of the monastery a century ago.
session_synopses.Escape: This cinematics plays when the Lance fires and the monastery and creche explodes. A heroic escape from a massive explosion.
session_synopses.PAD_Escaping_LeftRoof01: The player arrives on the left side of the roof as they are escaping the Lance explosion.
session_synopses.PAD_EnterGauntlet: Player comment that this place does not look abandoned at all.
session_synopses.PAD_FindOctogonal: Player remarks that this githyanki toy has a peculiar shape, and might well have a purpose beyond its current one (it controls the Lance)
session_synopses.AD_MagicMouthGauntlet01: A plaque communicating the warning of the Abbess to intruders in the gauntlet. It warns the passerby to turn back and to not disturb the place.
session_synopses.PAD_MagicMouthGauntletKnowledgeCheck: The player attempts to understand a magic mouth spell cast on a statue warning intruders to go leave the sacred area.
session_synopses.PAD_PreventiveDisarmLance: Player has disarmed the lance of the final dawn without ever activating it. The player characters celebrate retrieving the Blood of Lathander, a holy mace.

session_synopses.PAD_GremiskaCryReaction: The character hears the cry of the gremishkas, and reacts to it, drawing more attention to it.

node_data.speaker: Gish Umr'a'ac
node_data.text: Ren'thil was examined in the zaith'isk recently. Haven't seen him since - perhaps he got sent back to scout Moonrise.

AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck.speaker: Ra'jak
AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck.text: Aww... and I was having fun...

CorridorTeenagers.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers.text: What if they don't find the weapon? Do we even know it -
CorridorTeenagers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking urgently with Tra'anNodeContext: Hushed, urgent

CorridorTeenagers.speaker: Youth Qun'irel
CorridorTeenagers.text: An istik? But - but - you can't be here! I can't be seen with you! The ch'r'ai -
CorridorTeenagers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Realises the player is listeningNodeContext: Panicked

CorridorTeenagers.speaker: Youth Tra'an
CorridorTeenagers.text: Qun'irel! The Inquisition have more to worry about than who you talk to in the corridors.
CorridorTeenagers.context: NodeContext: Snapping the name, then exasperated

AD_CaptainGuardChatter.speaker: Raider Ahu'u'rag
AD_CaptainGuardChatter.text: Think the kith'rak will cheer up when we find it?

AD_CaptainGuardChatter.speaker: Raider Chy'raagh
AD_CaptainGuardChatter.text: I think we all will, when this pestilent search is finally over.

AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked.text: Don't be foolish. Provoke these githyanki, and they will crush your skulls into powder.

AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked.text: Provoke me, and I won't hesitate to join them.

MageHandMain.speaker: Zel'i
MageHandMain.context: InternalNodeContext: ke-CHOCK-ee (means "idiot")NodeContext: Irritated at the player's interruption of their game

MageHandMain.speaker: Player
MageHandMain.text: What's in the chest? It's making an awful noise.

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait.text: *You stand before a truly resplendent portrait of Queen Vlaakith in all her glory.*
VlaakithPortrait.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the portrait of Vlaakith

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait.text: Vlaakith herself. She is both the sun that blinds us and the void that contains us. Praise be.

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait.text: *In the corner of the painting is a small symbol you can't quite place.*
VlaakithPortrait.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pan down to shot of the symbol

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Player
VlaakithPortrait.text: Draw a new face onto the portrait.

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait.text: *You take a moment to fully appreciate your masterpiece.*
VlaakithPortrait.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The camera faces the player from the direction of the painting as they draw on the portrait (unseen off camera).
After this, a shot of now drawn-on portrait is shown.

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Narrator
VlaakithPortrait.text: *She certainly looks a little less regal now.*

VlaakithPortrait.speaker: Lae'zel
VlaakithPortrait.text: Pathetic and profane. You've the brain of a child.

AD_KidsFleeDormitory.speaker: Zel'i
AD_KidsFleeDormitory.text: A fight! Time to follow protocol...

PAD_DormitoryComment.speaker: Player
PAD_DormitoryComment.text: So githyanki sleep in beds too. How conventional.

AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer.speaker: Zel'i
AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer.context: NodeContext: Thinks this is one of the most hilarious things she's ever seen; knew that a gremishka was going to jump out at the player

session_synopses.AD_MageHandGremishkaBoxStuck: Kids comment that the box is now stuck.
session_synopses.CorridorTeenagers: The player has the chance to talk to a couple of chatty - but wary - gith youths in a corridor in the creche. They establish the fear around the inquisition.
session_synopses.AD_CaptainGuardChatter: Captain guard chatting to one of the patrolling guards.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelPlayersAttackUnprovoked: Laezel is warning the player to not mess around with the gith in this Creche.
session_synopses.MageHandMain: Two gith kids are pushing a chest (which secretly contains a gremishka) back and forth between them using their Mage Hands. You can tell them to stop and if you insist, eventually they'll step back from the box, letting the gremishka break out. Alternatively, if you try to join in or fail to get them to stop, they'll start shoving you.
session_synopses.VlaakithPortrait: The player can attempt to vandalize the portrait and can be caught by a nearby gith teenager.
session_synopses.AD_MageHandKid02PlayingShove: Two gith kids are playing shove with Mage Hands, pushing around a chest. From inside the chest can be heard child-like screams.
session_synopses.AD_KidsFleeDormitory: The kids start running away and shout that they are following the protocol for when a fight happens in the creche.Only the main kid says a line since they disappear pretty quickly and there likely won't be time for two lines. The shorter the better.
session_synopses.PAD_DormitoryComment: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to entering the dorms in the creche. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
session_synopses.AD_MageHandKid01PlayingShove: Two gith kids are playing shove with Mage Hands, pushing around a chest. From inside the chest can be heard child-like screams.
session_synopses.AD_MageHandKidLaughingAtPlayer: Gith kid comments about the gremishka coming out of the chest.
session_synopses.AD_InfirmaryGuard04ReactionToGremishka: The gith voicing his intent to attack the gremishka that spawned from the box.

session_synopses.AD_PlayerIsShoved: After the player interferes with their game, the githyanki kid shoves the player with her Mage Hand and tells them to get lost.

Device.speaker: Narrator
Device.text: *The device is strange, made of taut flesh and pockmarked metal. It waits for something.*
Device.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player does not immediately sit down - there's no knowing what this machine will do.

DoctorWaitsAtDevice.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
DoctorWaitsAtDevice.text: Go on. My time is vital - do not squander it.

DaisyAD_AfterZaithisk.text: You were lucky I was there to save you once again.

DeviceDoctorInterrupt.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
DeviceDoctorInterrupt.text: The zaith'isk is not a child's play thing.

DeviceDoctorInterrupt.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
DeviceDoctorInterrupt.text: If you require its services, speak to me. Otherwise - leave.

AD_DoctorAtAmbush.speaker: Ghustil Stornugoss
AD_DoctorAtAmbush.text: Purge the infected only. Leave enough to study.

OffstageArdent_SentToCaptain.speaker: 62add678-f00a-4603-8938-06ad25c03d18
OffstageArdent_SentToCaptain.text: This mess - this is your doing? Impressive. Our Captain may have use for you - report to her immediately.

PAD_DoorIsLocked.speaker: Player
PAD_DoorIsLocked.text: Locked in. That's rarely good news.

session_synopses.Device: The player attempts to remove their tadpole with the device, not realising that it will kill them as it does so. The player has opportunity to save themselves from the machine. If they fail or refuse those opportunities, Daisy will intervene. Variations based on whether the doctor and Lae'zel are present or not.
session_synopses.DoctorWaitsAtDevice: She urges the player to lie down in the Zaith'isk.
session_synopses.DaisyAD_AfterZaithisk: Daisy AD for after we use the zaith'isk.
session_synopses.DeviceDoctorInterrupt: The doctor prevents the player from using the device.
session_synopses.AD_DoctorAtAmbush: The doctor orders the guards to kill the players as the infirmary ambush begins.
session_synopses.OffstageArdent_SentToCaptain: An Ardent shows up after the infirmary ambush and sends the player to talk to the captain. This is to communicate to the player that they may continue exploring the Creche.
session_synopses.PAD_DoorIsLocked: The player tries to open the door after the Gith Doctor has left, locking you in.

node_data.speaker: Raider Ra'gur
node_data.text: Now we've got istik poking around here as well as an inquisitor? Chk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: iss-TIK meaning "outsider/non-gith(derogatory)", splendid said with utmost sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Raider Kyrr'a'ath
node_data.text: Your presence here is tolerated. Do not confuse it for being welcome.

node_data.speaker: Ur'uth
node_data.text: *Pant.*

node_data.speaker: Ul'mirel
node_data.text: Sa'varsh Kethk won't let us do anything fun 'til we pass this test.

node_data.speaker: Ul'mirel
node_data.text: I just want to learn how to crush someone's brain with my mind. Splat!
node_data.context: NodeContext: SO EXCITED, this is the MOST COOL THING

node_data.speaker: Kyr'das
node_data.text: I hope we start training with weapons soon. Reading is so boring.

AD_MainCheckpointChatter.speaker: Warrior Khunaruth
AD_MainCheckpointChatter.text: With your commanding officer dead, how long will you stay here?

AD_MainCheckpointChatter.speaker: Ardent Lin'a'an
AD_MainCheckpointChatter.text: Until the Inquisitor's slayer is found, and destroyed. No sooner.

AD_MainCheckpointChatter.speaker: Warrior Khunaruth
AD_MainCheckpointChatter.text: Do you have no leads? I thought you ardents were meant to be our intelligentsia.

AD_MainCheckpointChatter.speaker: Ardent Lin'a'an
AD_MainCheckpointChatter.text: Do I detect insubordination in your tone, vin'iisk?

AD_MainCheckpointChatter.speaker: Ardent Lin'a'an
AD_MainCheckpointChatter.text: Hold your tongue, lest I pull it from your skull.

HiddenCheckpointWarning.speaker: Warrior Qen
HiddenCheckpointWarning.context: NodeContext: Pronouced "Iss-tick", meaning outsider/non gith - preparing to attack

HiddenCheckpointWarning.speaker: Player
HiddenCheckpointWarning.text: A nautiloid crashed on your doorstep. Illithids are infecting the population. I need your help.

HiddenCheckpointWarning.speaker: Warrior Qen
HiddenCheckpointWarning.text: Kith'rak Therezzyn shares your concerns. You should seek her within.

MainCheckpointTrespassing.speaker: Lae'zel
MainCheckpointTrespassing.text: Faithful gish, Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai.
MainCheckpointTrespassing.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI. For the honour of Vlaakith.

MainCheckpointTrespassing.speaker: Gish Far'aag
MainCheckpointTrespassing.text: Halt. We were not expecting visitors, kin. What brings you here?

MainCheckpointTrespassing.speaker: Player
MainCheckpointTrespassing.text: Stand aside, or crumble in combat.

session_synopses.AD_MainCheckpointChatter: Main guards chatting while on duty. One intelligence officer, one normal Creche Y'llek guard.
session_synopses.HiddenCheckpointWarning: The guard warns you to stay away back. If the primary guard is dead, he will instead let you in or attack.
session_synopses.MainCheckpointTrespassing: The guards can be convinced to let you in if you are Gith-looking, produce the box, or persuade them you have a reason to be at the creche.

node_data.speaker: Ardent Vraalsith
node_data.text: Unless you want to be set up as target practice, I suggest you leave, istik.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'here' in the sense that the intelligence officer and the player are not from this creche

session_synopses: Intelligence officer watching over the training room. He's friendlier to gith, and tells non-gith to leave,

node_data.speaker: Ardent Qu'th
node_data.text: That Queen Vlaakith trusted you with such a task... You must not fail..

session_synopses: Intelligence officer reacts to your presence, both before and after the Templar dialogue

node_data.speaker: Raider Zar'an
node_data.text: I am watching you, istik.

session_synopses: One liner for a guard in the Hatchery.Raider Zar'an is a female githyanki, guarding the spawning pools in her hatchery. She's quiet and steely, suspicious of outsiders.

node_data.speaker: Ardent Kur'ashk
node_data.text: Kith'rak Therezzyn must be on her last chance by now. The ch'r'ai is not normally so lenient.

PAD_SpottingStatuesPerceptionCheck.speaker: Player
PAD_SpottingStatuesPerceptionCheck.text: Hmm, some strange grooves by the statues... I wonder if they can be moved?

PAD_AthleticsCheckFailed.speaker: Player
PAD_AthleticsCheckFailed.text: Damn thing is jammed shut. Won't turn like this.

session_synopses.PAD_SpottingStatuesPerceptionCheck: The player spots a set of statues that might be more movable than they first appear - and can be tipped off by a book in the monastery that bypasses the perception check.
session_synopses.PAD_AthleticsCheckFailed: PAD spoken when the player fails the athletics check to rotate the statue.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Yr'rk
node_data.text: On second thoughts, perhaps an inquisitive istik would make a good practice dummy.

AD_FightOutOfTheCreche.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_FightOutOfTheCreche.text: Tsk'va - my own people seek my head.

AD_FightOutOfTheCreche.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_FightOutOfTheCreche.text: To the zaith'isk. To the cure!

session_synopses.AD_FightOutOfTheCreche: Laezel says Vlaakith must have ordered the Creche to kill her. Says  they must fight their way through. If not been to the Zaithisk yet, she says they must go.

BarrierDeviceDialog.speaker: Githyanki Barrier Disruptor
BarrierDeviceDialog.text: Who would be... Oh. It is you.
BarrierDeviceDialog.context: NodeContext: he says this with a creeping excitement as he realises who the player is

BarrierDeviceDialog.speaker: Githyanki Barrier Disruptor
BarrierDeviceDialog.text: Make haste. We have business to conduct.

Captain.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain.text: I presume you are not stupid enough to return empty-handed. So give me the weapon - now.

Captain.speaker: Player
Captain.text: I've not found it yet - but I'm close. I just need more time.

Captain.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
Captain.text: Time is finite. As is my patience. Go.

AD_SecondTurn.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_SecondTurn.text: You will die by my sword, chraith!

AD_CultistCapture.speaker: Warrior Ith'dul
AD_CultistCapture.text: If you make it inside, we might even kill you before the captain's pets do.

PAD_CaptainsMapComment.speaker: Player
PAD_CaptainsMapComment.text: A map of the Sword Coast? What are the gith planning?

AD_CaptainRealizesTheft.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_CaptainRealizesTheft.text: Where is my key...? YOU. THIEF.

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar.context:
CinematicNodeContext: 5 githyanki are in the room alongside the Captain and the Inquisitor. 
3 of them are pouring over maps, 2 are getting equipment ready.
The captain is adressing the inquisitor. 
The inquisitor stands in the door arch in the corner, almost shrouded by shadow,

CaptainSpeaksToTemplar.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainSpeaksToTemplar.text: The latest patrol have not returned. I'm sorry, I -

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.text: This place is even more foreboding than the rest of the crche.

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.text: I agree, it'll be good to get out of this place.

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.text: This Inquisitor sounds like a real piece of work. Do you think he'll answer our questions?

PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.speaker: Player
PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar.text: It's never been that simple before, I don't know why it would be now.

PAD_DefeatCaptain.speaker: Player
PAD_DefeatCaptain.text: Well that's dealt with. But she wasn't the one pulling the strings here.

AD_ThirdTurn.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
AD_ThirdTurn.text: You will not embarrass me anymore!

CaptainWarning.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainWarning.text: Where do you think you're going? Take the artefact to the Inquisitor. Now.

CaptainWarning.speaker: Kith'rak Therezzyn
CaptainWarning.text: Any attempts to subvert me will result in your death.

GithGuardMonastery01.speaker: Raider Add'ath
GithGuardMonastery01.text: If I need to speak to a creature like you, I will do so. Begone.

GithGuardMonastery02.speaker: Warrior Ith'dul
GithGuardMonastery02.text: Yet again, the weapon eludes us. I've heard even Kith'rak Voss is searching now.

PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction.speaker: Player
PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction.text: Looks like the barrier's turned off. Lucky me.

session_synopses.BarrierDeviceDialog: In gameplay the player has inserted the key (stub name |Gith Shard|) into the barrier control device in the captain's office. The device turns on, and connects the palyer to the Inquisitor, who speaks through the device (voice only). If the Captain is still alive, she tries to interrupt, but the Inquisitor allows the players in.
session_synopses.Captain: Captain Therezzyn of Creche Yllek interrogates the player about the missing githyanki "weapon". We should learn:1. The githyanki's missing weapon and our artefact are THE SAME2. the githyanki were planning to attack moonrise towers
session_synopses.AD_SecondTurn:
Full context from combat - wed like to request some voicebarks for Captain Therezzyn combat in Creche

Therezzyns second turn (first one she calls for the guards)

Therezzyn: You die here and by my sword, intruder!

Therezzyns third turn

Therezzyn: Die already! I wont be embarrassed in front of my troops again!
session_synopses.AD_CultistCapture: Two gith gloat over a group of cultists, one of which has fallen to the ground while being frogmarched to the Captain. They kick him where he's fallen.
session_synopses.AD_CaptainCallsGuards: Captain calls the patrolling guard for help when combat starts.
session_synopses.PAD_CaptainsMapComment: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to interacting with the map in the Captain's office. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
session_synopses.AD_CaptainRealizesTheft: The captain tries to let the player in through the barrier in her office, but the player has already pickpocketed the key off her. She immediately suspects the outsiders, and turns hostile on them.
session_synopses.CaptainSpeaksToTemplar: The player overhears a conversation between Captain Therezzyn and the Templar. The Templar blames the captain for not having found the weapon yet and leaves.
session_synopses.PAD_OnTheWayToTemplar: Used for building up the moment when the player meets the templar.
session_synopses.AD_InquisitorAdmitsPlayer: The Inquisitor speaks through the door communicator located in the captain's office when the player interacts with it, admitting the player through.
session_synopses.PAD_DefeatCaptain: After defeating the captain, this PAD plays to nudge the player to investigate further (towards the Inquisitor).
session_synopses.AD_ThirdTurn:
Full context from combat - wed like to request some voicebarks for Captain Therezzyn combat in Creche

Therezzyns second turn (first one she calls for the guards)

Therezzyn: You die here and by my sword, intruder!

Therezzyns third turn

Therezzyn: Die already! I wont be embarrassed in front of my troops again!
session_synopses.CaptainWarning: The Captain reprimands the player for trying to just walk away after presenting her with the artefact. The player is warned not to walk out of the room. If they try again, they will be attacked.
session_synopses.GithGuardMonastery01: The guard is apprehensive about the captain's mood right now - the hunt for the weapon isn't going well.
session_synopses.PAD_DoorDeviceInteraction: The player attempts to interact with the door communicator in the Captain's Office after having talked to the inquisitor. Demonstrating no more interactivity with device.

AD_TeacherClass.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherClass.text: Strike hard. Slice flesh. No hesitation.

Student03.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03.text: I love fighting with daggers. It's so personal.

Student03.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03.text: You're close enough to see the light go out behind their eyes.

Student02.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02.text: Are you here to learn from our sa'varsh?

Student02.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02.text: He's so powerful and wise. No wonder Vlaakith puts such faith in him.

AD_TeacherCombatStart.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherCombatStart.text: Take up your weapons! Do not fail me!

GithBoy.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy.text: Thank you, ra'stil. The sa'varsh would have left me there to die.

GithBoy.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy.text: He's always telling us how we have to be ruthless, that death is the only mercy we deliver.

GithBoy.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy.text: But you... You showed compassion, and kindness. You're just like - never mind.
GithBoy.context: NodeContext: Growing enthusiasm, then catches himself at the last moment

GithBoy.speaker: Player
GithBoy.text: Next time I won't be there to intervene. Tread carefully.

GithBoy.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy.text: I will. Though every step I take feels like the wrong one.

GithBoy.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy.text: If I refuse to kill, but get myself killed in the process then I still failed to prevent a death.

GithBoy.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy.text: Morality is complex, jhe'stil, but I will keep trying to understand it. To understand him.
GithBoy.context: NodeContext: the 'him' is a mystery to the player, but idolised by the boy (his hero)

PAD_TrainingDummyComment.speaker: Player
PAD_TrainingDummyComment.text: A mind flayer dummy. Good for practising on.

AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead.text: You purged the weaklings - now I will purge you!

TeacherAfterBoyScene.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene.text: What is it? These insufferable interruptions are distracting from my lessons.

TeacherAfterBoyScene.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene.text: I do what is necessary, and no worse than our enemies would do.

TeacherAfterBoyScene.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene.text: Our warriors must possess strength and skill far superior to any spawned from this putrescent plane.

TeacherAfterBoyScene.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene.text: You will learn this first-hand, istik, when we finally come to claim it for our own.

session_synopses.AD_TeacherClass: The teacher stalks the classroom, barking instruction, "encouragement", and dogma at his students.
session_synopses.Student03: A malicious student watches the teacher beating Varrl, another student.
session_synopses.AD_GithBoy_AssaultReaction: Varrl's Assault reaction AD. He will say this when attacked and also when witnessing an attack, so writing must be applicable to both situations.
session_synopses.Student02: A fanatical student observes her teacher beating another student, then returns to her training.
session_synopses.AD_TeacherCombatStart: Combat AD by Githyanki teacher Savarsh on the first turn of combat.
session_synopses.GithBoy: If the Gith boy is unharmed, he can be persuaded to tell you about Orpheus, and subsequently to give you his copy of part of chapter 2.If he was stabbed (but not killed) by the player, the player can steal the chapter from him, or heal him and enter into the main conversation.
session_synopses.PAD_TrainingDummyComment: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react tointeracting with the training dummies. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
session_synopses.AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead: Combat AD from Githyanki teacher Savarsh on his first turn after all students are dead.
session_synopses.TeacherAfterBoyScene: Following the conclusion of the Githboy scene, the player has a follow up interaction with the teacher where they comment on his methods, and the scene's outcome.

node_data.speaker: Raider Jy'ir
node_data.text: What business have you in a crche dormitory, istik? Move along.

node_data.speaker: Youth Dyrr'kas
node_data.text: Must be nice to wander about wherever you want.

node_data.speaker: Ardent Lin'a'an
node_data.text: I find an operation runs much more efficiently under... proper observation.
